entry.title: Visualizations of Votes
entry.summary: In an email to the bitcoin-dev mailing list, a user suggested creating pie charts to visualize what percentage of votes are being cast for different Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs) based on data published in blocks. However, another user responded that pie charts are a poor tool for visualizing data and provided a link to an article explaining why bar charts are a better option. The article argues that pie charts can be misleading and difficult to interpret, while stacked or grouped bar charts can provide a clearer picture of the data.
